values:
If you haven't already please read Quatre's LJ.

Any questions, comments etc you'd like to ask me, please feel free. Thank you all for your support etc. I've enjoyed it, even though I'm a late comer to the RP.

Apologies for the brevity of this post, but with time zones and work I'm very pushed for time this morning and shouldn't even be on here.

Will write more later, and comment in my 'other' LJ tonight.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/10081.html

Happy birthday, <lj user="d_maxwell"> I hope both you AND Heero enjoy your day *winks* 

---

Things are settling down again, although I'm not sure whether I can use the term normal to describe my life at present. Truth be known, I'm not sure what defines normality anymore. The past few weeks have been a blur, and I've lost all track of time. I'm very tired even though I am sleeping, but both Tomas and I are doing much better than we were.

It's quieter now Quatre and Trowa have left. I miss their company. Their support, as with everyones was very much appreciated, and sorely needed.

Thank you too, to everyone who offered support and advice.

Rest in Peace, dear Peygan. You will always hold a special place in my heart.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/9943.html

I came online this morning with the intention of answering the comments left in my last post individually. However, half way through the first comment, I stopped. I just can't do this. Not yet. It's too painful.

*glances over to the bed where Tomas is still sleeping*

I can't help but think that I'm being very self-centred in allowing myself to wallow in self pity like this especially after what happened last night with Tomas.

It's a very humbling experience having the man you love crying in your arms and there's nothing you can do to make it better. He's lost the last of those he calls family, and he's not handling the situation well.

In public he's quiet, and putting on a brave face. He seems to feel that he has to live up to a standard with my family and friends even though I've told him that they will understand.

Last night he came to bed, and put his arms around me. He was shaking, and I stroked his hair. He leaned in closer and lost all that was left of his self control. I don't know how long we lay there holding each other, but we both cried at least a week's worth of tears before finally allowing sleep to claim us.

I need to go. Tomas is stirring and I don't want him to wake up alone.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/9484.html

I apologise for not thanking everyone personally who left comments in my last post regarding my sad loss. It is remiss of me, I know, and I hope you will accept my apologies.

It has been an extremely trying week, and I don't know how I would have gotten this far without the help and support of my family and friends.

I truly appreciate all of you.

Thank you again.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/9388.html

Peygan passed away late this afternoon.

Thank you everyone for your support. I had planned to make this a longer post, but...

I just can't.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/9195.html

I've spent the last week at the hospital after my visit to Aspen was cut short by a phone call from Tomas. Peygan collapsed last Monday, and was rushed to hosptial after suffering a massive heart attack.

He's been unconscious for the most part, since he was admitted, except for twice when he opened his eyes, smiled at us, and then closed them again.

He's growing weaker, and I'm scared he's not going to recover.

I've already watched one father die, I don't know if I have the strength to do it again. 

I'm also worried about Tomas. Peygan has been more of a father to him than an uncle, taking him and his mother in after his father died, and then providing comfort for Tomas when his mother passed away a few years later. 

He's very quiet, and I know he's trying to be strong but I'm not sure how long he can keep doing this. I might try to get him away from the hospital for an hour or so, just to get him to open up and talk, but I worry that if I do and something happens while we are gone, neither of us would ever forgive ourselves.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/8890.html

Happy birthday, Wufei :) 

I hope this year brings you the very best.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/8596.html

I've decided to visit for Wufei's birthday, to deliver his present in person - my flight leaves later this evening. I know it's short notice but, Zechs, would it be inconvenient for me to stay with you?

I'll also be bringing someone with me. Tomas has decided it's time he met my friends, and my brother, properly.

*gives you both a look* Do I really need to mention what will happen if you attempt to scare him off?
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/8359.html

Of the past few weeks I have one big regret, that Tomas and I didn't get together sooner. I've always enjoyed his company but this is different. He cares for me, he truly does, and I know I feel the same way about him. How do you know if you're falling in love with someone? I'm really not sure. All I know is that I want to see where our new found relationship takes us, spend all the time with him I can, and that I miss him when he's not around. Tomas makes me feel special. I often find myself smiling at the memory of a touch, a whisper, a comment. I've had relationships before and they have failed for various reasons. I pray that this time things will work out. I think I've finally found someone I can imagine myself growing old with and it's a wonderful yet scary feeling. Relena: *smiles at Tomas, and gives him a kiss* *winks* Tomas: *smiles back at quietly takes her hand, giving it a gentle squeeze* Relena: *leans in closer, wrapping both hands around yours* Tomas: *rests my forehead against yours* *quietly* Done working for the day? Relena: I do have more to do, but *glares over at my desk* it can wait till tomorrow I think. Tomas: *soft laugh* You always have more to do, and it can almost always wait until tomorrow. Are you hungry? Shall we get some dinner? Relena: *chuckles* One day it will disappear overnight rather than catching up with me in the morning. *Sighs* Dinner sounds nice. Anything in particular you'd like? Tomas: *slips an arm around your waist* Anything is fine. What would you like? Did you remember to eat lunch today? Relena: *looks guilty* I had a cup of coffee. Does that count? *reaches over and tucks a lock of hair behind your ear* Tomas: *arches an eyebrow* No, it does not. What am I going to do with you? Relena: *looks innocent* I can think of a few things *waggles eyebrows* Tomas: *short, quick laugh* Food first, if we're going to burn those calories. I don't want your stomach growling while I'm doing something wicked to you. *sly grin* Relena: *laughs* I do so like the way you think. *gives you a quick kiss* I could get very used to this... Tomas: *pauses, giving you an odd look* Could you? Get used to it? Could you really? Relena: *frowns, wondering what the look is for* *softly* I wouldn't have said it if I didn't mean it. Tomas: *smiles again, slowly* Okay. *leans in to give you a gentle kiss on the side of your mouth* *softly* Okay. Relena: *returns the kiss, enjoying the closeness* I do have one regret though..... Tomas: *sliding my hand up and down your back* What's that, Miss? Relena: *very softly* That we didn't do this sooner...*leans into your touch and gives a little shiver* Tomas: Ah. *nods* I have to agree with you there. *brings my other hand to your chin, tips it up and gives you a slow, lingering kiss* Relena: *shifts my arms around you, and pulls you closer* *moans slightly through the kiss, parting my lips slightly to allow you better access* Tomas: *swipes the tip of my tongue over your lips before slipping it into your mouth, my hand on your chin sliding back to cup the back of your head, fingers threading into your hair* Relena: *carresses your tongue with my own, breathing in slowly, trying to control my rising excitement* *slips my hands lower, cupping your ass and squeezing* Tomas: *makes a surprised noise against your mouth, breaking the kiss with a soft laugh* Why, Miss -what would people say if they could see you doing that? *tangles my fingers in your hair, enjoying the softness of it* Relena: *murmurs* Who says I have any intention of sharing? I rather like having you to myself....*strokes your cheek* Tomas: *still playing with your hair* As do I, with you. *leans in closer and nuzzles your cheek with mine* We have the whole evening to ourselves. How luxurious it seems... Relena: *Sighs happily* A whole evening...*slips my hand under your shirt and runs it up your back* Are you sure we really need to eat first? *traces a pattern on your bare back* I'd rather like to skip right to dessert.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/8175.html

Cathy and I had a little too much fun on April Fools this year. *grins* I enjoyed myself thoroughly. It was very sweet of Tomas to show his concern and offer to provide safe escort for our trip to Vegas. True to his word, he showed up at the palace, very much the protective gentleman. Naturally I couldn't make his trip a total waste so after I explained the situation, which he found quite amusing, I offered to take him out for dinner for his trouble. We had a wonderful evening, and during dinner he finally admitted that it was he who has been leaving me the flowers and other gifts. He has also asked if I would be interested in another 'date' and I've said yes. Note for Zechs and Heero: Don't even think of scaring this one off...
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/7768.html

Cathy,

I've decided that we can't keep hiding how we feel about each other. I have the marriage licence and tickets to Vegas. 

See you soon.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/7568.html

I found a beautiful bouquet of Easter lillies on my desk earlier today, together with a white stuffed rabbit and a box of chocolates. *smiles* This time there was a note: At length their long kiss severed, with sweet smart: And as the last slow sudden drops are shed From sparkling eaves when all the storm has fled, So singly flagged the pulses of each heart. Their bosoms sundered, with the opening start Of married flowers to either side outspread From the knit stem; yet still their mouths, burnt red, Fawned on each other where they lay apart. Sleep sank them lower than the tide of dreams, And their dreams watched them sink, and slid away. Slowly their souls swam up again, through gleams Of watered light and dull drowned waifs of day; Till from some wonder of new woods and streams He woke, and wondered more: for there she lay It's Nuptial Sleep, by Dante Gabriel Rosetti. I spent hours memorising the poem for school, and although I can't quote it now from memory, it's one I will always recognise. I suspect the person who left this for me knows that, if it's who I suspect, as I seem to remember complaining to him about having to do so at the time. Thank you :) although I do wish you'd make your identity known to me, as I don't want to approach you in case I'm wrong...
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/7283.html

Happy birthday, Lu.

*Hugs to a very good friend*

I'm not going to tell you to stay out of trouble as that would be a waste of time and no fun.

*winks*

I do, however, expect photos and a detailed account of what exactly you did while you were away. *gives Tristan a grin* Well maybe not ALL of what you did...
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/6972.html

Happy birthday, I hope you have a wonderful day, but if you get into trouble, please don't forget to arrange pictures to share *winks* --- Thanks to Tristan, I think I have an idea who left me the rose. I can't be certain as Tristan isn't being entirely helpful, and enjoying himself a little too much, but I'm unsure what my next step should be. I'm rather flattered that the person in question might think of me in this way, as I do hold feelings towards him, but... *shakes head* I'm supposed to be a diplomat and politician and know all the right words, but I'm completely lost in this situation.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/6669.html

Ask me a question - anything about me or my life - and I will give you an honest answer. I'm going to change this year's quiz a bit and allow any sort of question, though if it's completely tasteless and asked only for the shock factor rather than a genuine enquiry, I reserve the right to not answer. As Quatre has done, I am going to have to ask you to be patient in regard to answering as my schedule, too, is hetic at present.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/6518.html

After returning to my office with my mid morning coffee this morning I discovered a single red rose on my desk. I have no idea who it's from as there was no card attached.

*Smiles* Thank you to whoever arranged for it to be there. I truly appreciate the fact that I have such good friends.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/6360.html

I'm home again and trying to get back into routine. *sigh* I enjoyed the trip to New Orleans immensely. I can't remember the last time I had so much fun, and it was all the better for sharing it with friends. Unfortunately though too, seeing those friends together and happy with their partners of choice, only served to bring home to me just how alone I've felt since my relationship with Roger failed. I keep telling myself that I'm a strong person, that I don't need someone else to be happy, but it's not working as well as it should be. I'd like to believe that there is someone out there for me, but finding someone who is prepared to put up with my busy schedule and not put off by who I am, and everything attached to the Peacecraft name makes it all the more difficult. I doubt my friends have any idea that I feel this way and I'm not going to tell them. They have their own lives to lead and after everything they have been through it's not fair to burden them with it.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/6064.html

I have a few details to finish in regards to my latest business project and then I'm looking forward to joining my friends for the Mardi Gras celebrations. Thank you again for your kind invitation. Dorothy has been of great assistance in helping me to choose a costume, and thank you also to others in helping me narrow now the choice I had. It was a tough decision. *grin* She also insists that I must share, and Dorothy is not one easily refused: http://www.hollywoodcostumesandparty.com/legave/8982.jpg And, Zechs, a reminder that this is 'the lesser of the two evils', here is the link to the costume I wore at Halloween, as I was somewhat remiss in sharing that at the time though I must admit that the look on your face when you first saw it was rather amusing ;) http://www.ronjo.com/Merchant2/merchant.mvc?Store_Code=C&Screen=PROD&Product_Code=30237&Category_Code=wmn
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/5763.html

My best wishes and love to a very special person and friend.

*Hugs*

Happy birthday, Quatre :)

There's a parcel on its way to L4. My apologies for the delay but I had problems finding the 'perfect gift'.

*smirks*
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/5581.html

Now that the new years celebrations are over, I've begun looking for lodgings for Tristan at his request. He wishes to move to Cinque, to be closer to Lu as she starts restoration work on the palace. 

I already have a list of places which may be suitable; he is meeting me later today and I've offered to accompany him. It makes sense as I know the area and also it will give us an opportunity to chat over coffee afterwards; I didn't have the chance to speak with him over Christmas as much as I would have liked, much to my regret.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/5332.html

The house is no longer quiet; I can hear laughter and conversation in low tones from the various guest suites that my friends are occupying. This is what it means to have family and it's not something I would trade for the world.

We're comfortable with each other; with my friends I can be myself and relax. There's no need to worry about the correct way of doing things, or what others think. They accept me for who I am - with no concerns for my position - and I accept them for who they are in return. 

I do regret having lost touch over the past few years, but they have accepted that too, without question. It's been my own loss, and I'm determined - one could almost call it a New Years Resolution if I believed in such things, which I don't - not to let my work detain me from keeping in regular contact with my friends, with my family. 

On a lighter note, although I'm sure Trowa would disagree with me...Dorothy has a weird sense of humour. She is well aware that Trowa does not feel entirely comfortable around her, and she has made it her mission to wander past him, while he is here, eating various pieces of fruit while in the process of cutting said fruit with small sharp objects. They pass each other, exchange very cool greetings and keep walking. I know she's doing it on purpose, but she denies it of course. But I have noticed that she's eaten more fruit since his arrival than I have seen her consume over the past month. 

*shakes head*
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/4885.html

There are some things that a girl doesn't need to see.

I should have realised something when I heard noises as soon as the elevator door opened to my brother's appartment and I heard him calling Wufei's name. I paid it no heed; Wufei often visits, they work together and are friends.

By no stretch of the imagination did I expect the doors to open to...

I know my brother is well...er, yes...but I didn't need to see proof of it or him...

*blushes bright red*

I'm wondering if I need to have a chat to Wufei or if he's aware...

Oh my.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/4757.html

A big thank you to Lu and Tristan for their hospitality over the past few days. It's been fun.

*winks at Lu*

Some people are so fetching in various shades of red, don't you think? *pats my camera and smirks*

I'm heading home shortly as I need to be back in Cinque for when the circus arrives. I've decided though, very last minute, to detour through New York and surprise my brother. There's something I need to discuss with him which I didn't have a chance to do while we were both here and I'd prefer to do it in person.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/4377.html

I've just discovered a parcel on the front doorstep. The mail was delivered a while ago, so this must have arrived somewhat late.

The return address is from Howard. Hmm, I wonder what kind of Christmas gift Howard is sending Lu. This could be interesting. I'll give it to her and hope she shares...

---

A very Happy and Joyful Christmas to all my friends who celebrate it, and happy holidays to those who don't.

I'm very much enjoying spending the season with friends, and look forward to catching up with those who were unable to be here before the year is out.

---

Thank you, too, Megan, for the card. It's very much appreciated. :)
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/4263.html

I'm hoping to come a few days earlier if that is all right with you. Dorothy's offered to take over so that I can get away, and I'm going to accept her offer. Frankly, I've had enough of the endless reporters wanting an 'exclusive' interview regarding my side of this mess, and I'm debating a recording of my voice saying 'no comment' *Sigh* Roger appears to have dropped off the planet; for which I am very relieved. I can't believe the nerve of that man. *unladylike snort* Did he seriously believe that I would protect him from whatever threats his imagination presumed he was receiving? *coughs* Let me know what time and days suits you and I'll fit in. I don't want to cause you or Tristan any trouble because of my change of plans.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/4031.html

My apologies for any unladylike language in this post but...

I don't believe this. Of all the low life bastards. His version of events is not what happened between us. How could I have ever trusted this man? I don't know what he thinks he's going to achieve.

Don't bother to answer that statement. I know exactly what he's trying to achieve.

*swears under breath and throws the latest copy of the Cinque newspaper across the room*
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/3684.html

My apologies again for having to decline the invitation to join you all for Thanksgiving. *sigh* However, the interviewing process is finally over and my new assistant starts tomorrow.

After much contemplation, I decided that Dorothy was the best candidate by far, and have offered her the position, which she has accepted. I'm ignoring the smirk on her face as she did so, for the moment. I'm sure this will be an interesting learning curve for both of us. 

However, she has made it quite clear that her duties will not include picking up my coffee in the mornings. I need to ring the cafe and see if they deliver...

After all I do have some standards to maintain.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/3461.html

I will be sending a package to Quatre on Monday.  

Please remember that I am merely feeding an already existing addiction...
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/3113.html

Happy birthday, Zechs :)

I hope you enjoy the parcel I've sent. *winks* I assure you it's quite safe to open...
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/3070.html

I'm heading back to Cinque on Monday as unfortunately I have to start interviewing possible candidates for the position of my personal assistant. *Sigh* As much as I think Dorothy's resume is the most promising, I have suspicions that Trowa may be right and that I will have to find someone else to pick up my essential early morning suppplies. Yes, I am sadly addicted to coffee. 

Quatre and Trowa have been the perfect hosts, and Trowa and I have enjoyed several late night conversations over a cup of hot chocolate but I cannot impose on them any longer. Besides, I have the feeling that some quality time alone, without extra house guests, might be well appreciated at present.

I'll call in to see Duo one last time before I depart. Heero, could you please keep me posted as to his progress? *hugs to both of you*
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/2692.html

Happy birthday <lj user="iria_winner_md">

I know I've already conveyed my best wishes for your birthday in private, but I wanted to do it in public too.

*Smirks*

I hope you put that gift certificate to good use *winks*
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/2417.html

I wish there was something I could say or do to reassure Heero that Duo will be all right. This isn't his fault; there was no way of knowing that Duo would react to the transfusion - as far as I'm aware the doctors don't even know what exactly he is reacting to.

Trowa's going to try to persuade him to try to get some sleep but I can't see any of us getting much in the way of sleep tonight. 

I know I won't be.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/2112.html

I have arrived safely on L4, and had no problems locating Trowa - or rather he had no problems locating me.

*smiles*

It's wonderful to see old friends again, although I must admit my concerns over recent events *frowns* I wish there was more I could do to help; it's times like this that I feel extremely inadequate, especially as my friends are all so very capable. I've been told that I shouldn't feel this way, that my skills lie in other directions, but even so...

In saying that though, I do not mean to imply that I am wholly unable to defend myself, or protect those I care about. I still remember how to use a gun, although I prefer not to use one unless neccessary,  but I have learnt over recent years that there are those who will not allow themselves to be reasoned with. It is a shame that there are still people out there who will lower themselves to this kind of behaviour to further their own agenda. 

On a brighter note - my costume is still safely packed at the bottom of my suitcase. It would rather spoil the surprise if others were to see it ahead of time.

My brother's reaction should be especially interesting...
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/1972.html

I've just confirmed my flight for Friday - I'll be arriving on L4 at 5pm. Quatre, are you or Trowa able to meet me, or should I make my own way to your home?

Duo, my Halloween costume for the party is safely packed at the bottom of my suitcase as are the accessories that go with it. *winks*
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/1566.html

Jobs for your LJ Friends by brianwarnersgrl
Username
are you sure you want to know?
positive?
ok this person is a hooker:backfromhell
this person is a wrestler:babspace

this person will be the future president in 2026:hexadecimal00
this person is a babymaker:ashkahchan
this person is a drug dealer:misanagi
this person is a stripper:silent_trtmnt03
and of course we all knew they would be a nunbillion_dlr_boy
Quiz created with MemeGen!
It appears as though my brother has been hiding something from me... as have Trowa and Quatre. A stripper and a nun, hmm? Unless they're still deciding on halloween costumes...
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/1495.html

The position of personal assistant seems to have attracted quite a few applicants. It's going to take me a while to read through them all and decide on a short list. 

There are several with great potential, though I do wonder as to Dorothy's motives for applying. She didn't mention that she was planning to when we spoke the other day.

But then, Dorothy has always liked to keep me on my toes, and I don't expect that to change anytime soon.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/1092.html

Someone suggested that I try this meme.
What Kind of Super-Villian Are You?
LJ Username
Pick An Evil Number
Pick An Evil Word
Pick An Evil Color
You Are A Criminal Mastermind
Your Evil Lair Is An Ancient Tomb
Your Evil Name Is Duke Devil Strong
Your Nemesis Is nataliethompson
Your Evil Hardware of Choice Is Toys of Terror
Your Partner In Crime Is dmaxwell
This cool quiz by ezralitemikey - Taken 2498 Times.
New - Dating Advice written by YOU!
Duo. It appears as though they are on to us *winks*
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/828.html

I found this on several journals on my friends list, and as it looked interesting... It was also a good distraction from the application forms beginning to arrive from hopeful potentials for what used to be Roger's position. I'm not looking forward to the interviewing process, but I can't afford to be without a personal assistant for too long.
I am Progressive Girl

Click on the picture below to read more:

Take the 'What Kind of Girl Are You?' quiz at CookingToHookup.com

Progressive, hmm?
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/525.html

Hello, and thank you to those who have already welcomed me to Live Journal. *Smiles* I was warned that it would be difficult to remain anonymous but I was very surprised as to how quickly I was noticed. I am very pleased to be here. Quatre, if you need to contact me further, please use my home number. I have arranged for the calls to be forwarded to me no matter where I am. *frowns* I am fairly certain that you have it; if you don't, Heero definitely does. My apologies again for not receiving your initial calls. The matter has been dealt with and I am presently without a personal assistant until I can find a replacement for Roger. *sighs* I still can't believe how foolish I was to believe that I could trust that man. But then, I mistakely also believed that our agreement to end our relationship was a mutual one. Either he is a better liar than I thought, or... *Shakes head* Regarding the current situation, unfortunately it would be difficult for me to leave Cinque at present, but if I am needed, I will be there. Duo, take care. And please, everyone, be careful.
http://peacecrafty.livejournal.com/317.html
